Constructs new numeric array from various sources.
@1@ Default constructor. Constructs an empty numeric array.
@2@ Constructs a numeric array with {{c|count}} copies of [[cpp/language/value initialization|value-initialized]] elements.
@3@ Constructs a numeric array with {{c|count}} copies of {{c|val}}.
@4@ Constructs a numeric array with copies of {{c|count}} values from an array pointed to by {{c|vals}}. If this array contains less than {{c|count}} values, the behavior is undefined.
@5@ Copy constructor. Constructs the numeric array with the copy of the contents of {{c|other}}.
@6@ Move constructor. Constructs the container with the contents of {{c|other}} using move semantics.
@7-10@ [[cpp/language/converting constructor|Converting constructor]]. Convert the corresponding data structure to a {{tt|valarray}}.
@11@ Constructs the numeric array with the contents of the initializer list {{c|il}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|count|the number of elements to construct}}
{{par|val|the value to initialize the elements with}}
{{par|vals|pointer to a C array to use as source to initialize the contents}}
{{par|other|another numeric array to use as source to initialize the contents}}
{{par|sa|slice array to initialize the elements with}}
{{par|gsa|generic slice array to initialize the elements with}}
{{par|ma|mask array to initialize the elements with}}
{{par|ia|indirect array to initialize the elements with}}
{{par|il|initializer list to initialize the elements with}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
@1-5, 7-11@ {{cpp/impldef exception item}}
